name: Echolalia as Communication
description: Structured activity time where children are working on puzzles at tables. Child_5 uses delayed echolalia functionally - repeating phrases from a favorite TV show to communicate needs and emotions. The teacher recognizes these patterns and responds to the underlying intent. When child_5 says 'to infinity and beyond' while reaching for a puzzle piece another child has, the teacher interprets this as a request and facilitates sharing. Later, child_5 echoes 'I'm not scared' (from a movie) when the lights flicker briefly, which the teacher acknowledges as self-reassurance. The session demonstrates how echolalia serves communicative functions.

focus_children.description: Uses delayed echolalia functionally, verbal but primarily through scripted phrases, strong visual memory

key_moments.description: Child_5 uses 'to infinity and beyond' to request puzzle piece
Teacher interprets and facilitates the request
Lights flicker, child_5 uses self-reassurance script
Teacher validates the emotional regulation attempt
